title: The Pastimes of Durga Devi | His Holiness Sri Stoka Krishna Swami | Gaura Mandala Parikrama 2024
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: So we are in this most holy place
where there is this deity of goddess Dhakeshwari.
She is Durga Devi and who is Durga Devi is very nicely explained by Prabhupad in the Krishnabook.
This is the instance where Rukmini,
who was kidnapped by Krishna on the request of Rukmini.
So she was arranged to be married to Shishupala, but she wrote to Krishna that I don't want to marry him, I want to marry you.
Of course, Rukmini is eternally the consort of Krishna.
But this is the pastime of Krishna.
So she is participating in the pastime and her marriage was anyway arranged and Krishna had to kidnap her,
take her away by force before she was actually given away in charity to Shishupala.
Then just before the marriage ceremony,
it was a tradition that the bride Rukmini,
she will go and worship Durga, goddess Durga.
Rukmini offered her prayers to the deity of Durga Devi.
I offer my respectful obeisances unto you as well as to your children.
Goddess Durga has four famous children.
If you carefully observe the deity here,
you can see her four children there with her.
and the goddess of learning Saraswati.
Where we had the Guru Puja,
you can more clearly see that.
Extreme ends are Ganesha to your left and Kartikeya to your right,
And then Lakshmi to the left,
Since goddess Durga is always worshipped with her famous children,
Rukmini specifically offered her prayers to the deity in that way.
Ordinary people pray to Durga for material wealth,
desired to have Krishna for her husband.
she prayed that the deity be pleased with her and bless her with that
her worship of the demigods is not condemned.
Srila Prabhupada also says in the same chapter,
the Gopis worshipped goddess Katyaini to get Krishna as their husband.
Rukmini was thinking of the various types of demigods,
Praying to the demigods to achieve the favour of Krishna is not irregular.
And Rukmini was fully absorbed in thoughts of Krishna.
Srila Prabhupada says about this mention of the demigods in the Brahma Samhita.
there are mantras offering obeisances to Lord Shiva,
all of whom are worshipped by the impersonalists as Panchopasana.
Vaishnavas can also worship all these demigods,
but only on the principles of the Brahma Samhita,
which is recommended by Sri Chaitanya Mahaprabhu.
We may note in this connection,
the mantras for worshipping Lord Shiva,
as described in the Brahma Samhita.
So what are these mantras in the Brahma Samhita?
All of you repeat after me,
since we are in the temple of Durga Devi,
so we will offer this prayer to Gurga Devi
as given in the Brahma Samhita.
All of you are familiar with this particular prayer
who is of the nature of the shadow of the chit potency,
is worshipped by all people as Durga,
the creating, preserving and destroying agency
I adore the primeval Lord Govinda
And in the purport to this verse,
purports given by his divine grace,
the world in which Brahma takes his stand
and hymns the Lord of Goloka.
this world is called Devi Dhama,
She is always riding a lion,
that you can clearly see also.
She is the mother of two sons,
Whereas Lakshmi in the spiritual world
when we were studying at least,
then you can do well in your exams
But Saraswati in the spiritual world
She is armed with twenty weapons.
she is actually armed with twenty weapons,
